sentences: Robin Cho, better known as Choice37, is a Korean-American record producer, songwriter, and DJ based in South Korea.
He joined YG Entertainment as a producer in 2009, and has since produced songs for K-pop artists including Big Bang, Blackpink, G-Dragon, Ikon, and Lee Hi.
Choice37 was born and raised in Los Angeles, California, where he was a member of the hip hop group Longevity Crew.
In 2008 he moved to South Korea where he was introduced to YG Entertainment CEO Yang Hyun-suk by childhood friend and record producer Teddy Park.
Choice37 soon began working for YG, and his song, "Butterfly," performed by G-Dragon, was released in 2009.
